thread.title: Tranquill brothers recovering from 2nd individual ACL injuries
thread.title_full: Tranquill brothers recovering from 2nd individual ACL injuries

title: Tranquill brothers recovering from 2nd individual ACL injuries
text:
Tranquill brothers recovering from 2nd individual ACL injuries 
By Kayla Crandall -21Alive Tranquill brothers recovering from 2nd individual ACL injuries October 13, 2015 Updated Oct 13, 2015 at 4:56 PM EDT 
UNDATED (21Alive) -- Two local college football stars are down for the count with ACL injuries and are now on the road to recovery. 
Justin Tranquill, a freshman at Western Michigan University, went down last week with an ACL injury. 
He went into surgery on Tuesday and according to Justin Tranquill's Twitter account, the surgery was a success. Surgery was a success!! Can't thank everybody enough for their prayers and support���� God is truly good — Justin Tranquill (@j_tranquill1) October 13, 2015 
Justin's older brother Drue Tranquill, a Carroll High School grad and a Safety for Notre Dame, also suffered from an ACL injury this year. 
Drue Tranquill was injured while celebrating a pass break-up in the game against Georgia Tech on Sept. 20. 
Drue Tranquill underwent surgery on Oct. 8. "I'm trusting Your provision." Thank you for all the prayers... I'm heading into surgery now�� — Drue Tranquill (@d_TraNquill) October 8, 2015 Big Tranq right before he headed into surgery��.. God has your best interest in mind DT - always does ���� #Psalm23 pic.twitter.com/fbOjociAfS — Justin Tranquill (@j_tranquill1) October 8, 2015 
For both brothers, this is their second ACL injury. 
Now the brothers will have time to recover together, and they might even be competitive about it. And just so everybody knows�� @d_TraNquill pic.twitter.com/DLOplQvwzh — Justin Tranquill (@j_tranquill1) October 13, 2015
